bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George P. Berry, January 17, 1953

div1.p: Hench commends Berry on his choice of Caswell to represent the Harvard Medical School at the Camp Lazear dedication. He is sending Berry some material from the ceremony and will send pictures if desired. He would like to be reimbursed for the wreath honoring Leonard Wood.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George P. Berry, January 17, 1953
div1.opener:
January 17, 1953
Dr. George P. Berry, Dean
Harvard Medical School
25 Shattuck Street
Boston, Massachusetts
My dear Doctor Berry:
div1.p:
We really had a very nice time at the dedication of Camp Lazear and you could
not possibly have chosen a better representative than Mr. Caswell. He was of
very great help to me as you will read in the enclosed memorandum concerning
the dedication of Camp Lazear which I have written essentially as a personal
letter to the relatives of those honored. I thought you would like to have a
copy. I hope you will find something of interest in it and perhaps some
amusing sidelights.

Let me say again that Mr. Caswell gave me a great deal of help which I found
I badly needed. I don't know what I would have done without him and he and
his good wife practically took over the responsibility of the 13 floral wreaths
the morning of the dedication, acting as a most efficient stage director behind
the scenes while certain brass hate hold the spotlight.

I enclose some newspaper clippings which will show you, I hope, something of
the very sympathetic response of the Cuban people. It was extremely ap-
propriate that the Americans should have participated. General Wood's
daughter was the guest of honor and seems to have had a grand though very
busy time.

Two or three photographs of Mr. Caswell laying the Harvard wreath before
General Wood's plaque were taken by news photographers. I was given copies
but Doctor Nogueira expected to borrow the films and send them to me shortly
in case you should wish to use one in connection with a little write up of
the affair in a Harvard medical or alumni bulletin. Thank you again very
sincerely for participating in this affair. Your participation was very
important.

The cost of each wreath was $15. They were really very lovely and would have
cost two or three times that much here. They were purchased from “Milagros
Flores,” Lucila Schumann, President, who gave me only one bill itemizing
each wreath and institutional donor. If you need an ozalid copy I can send
it. Otherwise I should be glad to receive a check for $15 at your convenience.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
